body_html:
This seems to have worked for me:
Uninstalled pytorch and pytorch-cpu
Install pytorch-cpu conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu
If that does not work, uninstall pytorch(es) and:

  • install VS 2017 redistributable installer
  • conda install -c peterjc123 vc vs2017_runtime
  • conda install mkl_fft intel_openmp numpy mkl
  • pip install numpy mkl intel-openmp mkl_fft
  • conda install -c defaults intel-openmp -f
  • conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu
    Sources: Pytorch Windows FAQ, Super DataScience
body_text:
This seems to have worked for me:
Uninstalled pytorch and pytorch-cpu
Install pytorch-cpu conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu
If that does not work, uninstall pytorch(es) and:

install VS 2017 redistributable installer
conda install -c peterjc123 vc vs2017_runtime
conda install mkl_fft intel_openmp numpy mkl
pip install numpy mkl intel-openmp mkl_fft
conda install -c defaults intel-openmp -f
conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu
Sources: Pytorch Windows FAQ, Super DataScience
body:
This seems to have worked for me:
Uninstalled pytorch and pytorch-cpu
Install pytorch-cpu `conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu` 
If that does not work, uninstall pytorch(es) and:
- install [VS 2017 redistributable installer](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/VC_redist.x64.exe)
- `conda install -c peterjc123 vc vs2017_runtime`
- `conda install mkl_fft intel_openmp numpy mkl`
- `pip install numpy mkl intel-openmp mkl_fft`
- `conda install -c defaults intel-openmp -f`
- `conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch-cpu` 
Sources: [Pytorch Windows FAQ](https://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/windows.html#import-error), [Super DataScience](https://www.superdatascience.com/pytorch/)
